name: sawing, hardwood | sawdust, loose, wet, measured as dry mass | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/12924/documentation

This dataset represents the service of sawing one m3 hardwood at a sawmill. ;The process chain in a sawmill is a net of interlinked processes; the process structure depends on the individual design and technologies in place for each sawmill. The structuring of the sawmilling processes is based on the identification of the core processes in a sawmill that are attributable to several co-products (such as upstream processes like forestry and transport of logs to the sawmill) sorting, storing and the sawing of the (debarked) log. Other processes are attributable directly to one of the co-products such as the chipping of residual wood (either after sawing or as part of the profile chipping), the chipping of the bark (the "debarking") or the suction of saw dust as collection and internal transport.

The sawing process starts with the sorting of the log at the sawmill.

This activity ends with sawn hardwood, at sawmill; the processing of all co-products from the sawing process are covered in separate datasets.The dataset does not include dust emissions to the environment because of lack of data.
category: C:Manufacturing/16:Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials/161:Sawmilling and planing of wood/1610:Sawmilling and planing of wood

processDocumentation.samplingDescription: complementary literature and sampling from sawmills
